As night falls, Budapest is transformed into a glittering jewel, offering a fairytale spectacle for visitors ğŸŒŒ. The golden lights of the Chain Bridge are reflected in the calm waters of the Danube, creating a magical and romantic atmosphere ğŸŒ‰.

The streets come alive, the cafÃ© terraces fill up and music echoes in the most unexpected corners of the city ğŸ¶. The majestic Parliament lights up, dominating the cityscape with its Gothic splendour ğŸ°.

A night cruise on the Danube is a must, offering panoramic views of Budapest's iconic monuments, all magnificently illuminated ğŸš¢. The SzÃ©chenyi thermal baths, with their warm waters and mystical vapours, invite you to relax under a starry sky ğŸŒ .

Budapest by night is an invitation to discovery, reverie and enchantment. Let yourself be carried away by the magic of this unforgettable city ğŸŒ™.

Santorini, the most magical of the Greek islands. This island of the Cyclades offers a multitude of activities to its visitors.

From discovering its historical heritage to watching the sunset over the Aegean Sea, to black sand beaches and boat trips, there is something for everyone. Here's a rundown of the best things to do in Santorini.

Fira, the capital, is one of the places not to be missed. With its white and blue houses, small cobbled streets, fashion boutiques and luxury hotels with swimming pools, it represents the essence of the island.

The village of Oia is also not to be missed for its spectacular beauty

The archaeological site of Akrotiri is an exciting getaway for history and culture lovers.

The ancient city of Thera is also worth a visit to learn more about the island's history

For food lovers, the Greek cuisine in Santorini is not to be missed, especially the famous souvlaki

Boat trips around the island are a pleasant way to discover the wonders of Santorini. The boat cruise, which allows you to visit the volcanic island and to reach the top of the crater of the volcano Nea Kameni, is a very popular activity

Sea kayaking from the red beach is also a fun activity that allows you to discover the volcanic coast and the fabulous sea caves

To finish the day, the sunset on Oia is one of the most famous activities in Santorini.

However, for those who are looking to watch the sunset from the water, the alignments may be better in Fira or Imerovigli.

Share this post with a friend who loves Greece

Take a voyage back in time to Rothenburg, a medieval German town that is considered the most charming in Bavaria.

Rothenburg has a rich history that dates back to the Middle Ages. The town was founded in 1170 and thrived due to its strategic location on an important trade route. The town's historic buildings have been preserved in their original state and offer visitors a unique glimpse into life in the Middle Ages.

Start by walking through the streets of the old town, admiring the historic buildings and beautiful views.

Be sure to visit the city hall, built in 1250, as well as climb the steps of the clock tower for a spectacular view of the city's rooftops, churches and historic buildings.

Last but not least, don't miss a visit to the medieval fortress called Burggarten, which also offers a breathtaking view of the city. It's the perfect place to take memorable pictures.

Which photo do you prefer?

Don't forget to share with a friend who loves the Middle Ages

The hidden gems of France: Discover the 10 most beautiful churches. Each of them has a unique history and breathtaking beauty that will leave you speechless, here is our selection of the 10 most beautiful churches in France:

1. Sainte Chapelle: This 13th century church is located in Paris and is famous for its spectacular stained glass windows.

2. Saint Germain des PrÃ©s: This Parisian church has unique medieval frescoes, a famous organ and a square tower.

3. Sainte CÃ©cile in Albi: Built in red brick, this gothic church is an architectural gem in the city of Albi.

4. Rouen Cathedral: This Gothic church in the city of Rouen is home to many artistic treasures, including stained glass windows and paintings.

5. Notre Dame de la Treille in Lille: This modern Gothic church is famous for its bold architecture and steel spire bell tower.

6. Saint Pierre de Beauvais: This 13th century gothic church was built with barrel vaults and a facade decorated with sculptures.

7. Saint Maurice de Lille: This Gothic church contains remarkable works of art, including stained glass windows and murals.

8. Reims Cathedral: This Gothic church is famous for its imposing architecture and colorful stained glass windows.

9. Notre Dame de FourviÃ¨re in Lyon: This basilica built on a hill overlooks the city of Lyon and offers a spectacular view of the city.

10. Palais BÃ©nÃ©dictine in FÃ©camp: This gothic church houses a collection of religious art, as well as beautiful furniture and colorful stained glass windows.

Do you know these churches? Which one is your favorite?
